most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?

common_issues.title: Pieces OS crashes and account linking issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashes due to native_extensions_plugin.dll, with workarounds involving DLL replacement or file deletion.  Account linking problems persist, preventing simultaneous Google and GitHub integration.  Support suggests temporary fixes and investigates underlying causes, including authentication flow issues and potential email conflicts.  A new authentication service is under development.

related_issues.title: Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
related_issues.text:
Crash due to native_extensions_plugin.dll
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS crashes. I’ve reinstalled the program, turned off the antivirus and firewall, updated the graphics driver, but nothing helps, it crashes consistently.
Windows 10, 64 bit, i3-12100F, RAM: 32 Gb, GTX 950.
If there's no solution, how can I disable this plugin so that it simply doesn't crash?

Here are the debug details:
```
0:000> r rcx
rcx=0000000000000000
0:000> k
 # Child-SP          RetAddr               Call Site
00 0000000e`28deeb00 00007ff9`9365e0ea     native_extensions_plugin!NativeExtensionsPluginCApiRegisterWithRegistrar+0x13796
01 0000000e`28deed20 00007ff9`9365fabf     native_extensions_plugin!NativeExtensionsPluginCApiRegisterWithRegistrar+0xc97a
02 0000000e`28deee50 00007ff9`9365d196     native_extensions_plugin!NativeExtensionsPluginCApiRegisterWithRegistrar+0xe34f

04 0000000e`28deef90 00007ff9`93667b11     native_extensions_plugin!NativeExtensionsPluginCApiRegisterWithRegistrar+0xe307
05 0000000e`28def000 00007ff9`92bad9fd     native_extensions_plugin!NativeExtensionsPluginCApiRegisterWithRegistrar+0x163a1
06 0000000e`28def110 00007ff9`9231900e     flutter_windows!InternalFlutterGpu_Texture_AsImage+0x1622b9
07 0000000e`28def1a0 00007ff9`923d0647     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0x2c56
08 0000000e`28def350 00007ff9`923ddddc     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xba28f
09 0000000e`28def3d0 00007ff9`923ddd7a     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xc7a24
0a 0000000e`28def400 00007ff9`923de4e4     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xc79c2
0b 0000000e`28def440 00007ff9`923db45b     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xc812c
0c 0000000e`28def480 00007ff9`923dc9e7     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xc50a3
0d 0000000e`28def630 00007ff9`923c7f88     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xc662f
0e 0000000e`28def680 00007ff9`9231a521     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0xb1bd0
0f 0000000e`28def6b0 00007ff9`9232e2e9     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0x4169
10 0000000e`28def7f0 00007ff9`9232fb4d     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0x17f31

12 0000000e`28def900 00007ffa`188bef5c     flutter_windows!FlutterDesktopTextureRegistrarMarkExternalTextureFrameAvailable+0x1987d
13 0000000e`28def930 00007ffa`188be684     USER32!CallWindowProcW+0x60c
14 0000000e`28defac0 00007ff7`59bf52e6     USER32!DispatchMessageW+0x4a4
15 0000000e`28defb40 00007ff7`59c0063a     os_server+0x52e6
16 0000000e`28defd90 00007ffa`18e07374     os_server+0x1063a
17 0000000e`28defdd0 00007ffa`19d1cc91     KERNEL32!BaseThreadInitThunk+0x14
18 0000000e`28defe00 00000000`00000000     ntdll!RtlUserThreadStart+0x21
```


I would appreciate any help :3
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key points raised:
- KiberAndy experiences crashes with Pieces OS and native_extensions_plugin.dll
- KiberAndy creates a workaround by replacing the DLL with an empty stub
- The extension remains invisible in Visual Studio Code
- Mark (Pieces Support) requests debug or additional information

### Problems identified:
- Crashes in Pieces OS with native_extensions_plugin.dll
- Extension invisibility in Visual Studio Code
- Potential issue with LTM Flow

### Solutions proposed/implemented:
- KiberAndy creates a workaround with an empty stub DLL
- Mark (Pieces Support) suggests a temporary fix by deleting a specific file
- Mark (Pieces Support) requests additional investigation into DLL and LTM Flow

### Current status/outcome:
- Crashes resolved with workaround and temporary fix
- Extension now visible in Visual Studio Code
- Further investigation needed into the root cause

### Additional notes:
- Mark (Pieces Support) plans to share updates on the ongoing investigation.
- KiberAndy has provided the Pieces OS application and database for analysis.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Initial issue: User (@johnkennyuk) is unable to link their personal domain and Google account due to an old, buggy authentication flow.
* Proposed solutions: 
    * Temporary fix by merging accounts and making Google account the main one.
    * Permanent fix with a new authentication service.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing linking flow was not straightforward and prone to bugs.
* Possible issue with email capitalization causing the linking failure.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Temporary: Merged accounts and made Google account the main one.
* Permanent: New authentication service is under development.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Temporary fix is implemented, but user is waiting for the new authentication service.
* New service is still under development and release date is pushed to early/mid March.
* Issue will be re-addressed when the new service is available.

**Additional Notes:**

* New authentication service is expected to allow linking of even more account types.
* User is encouraged to schedule a call with support for further assistance.

**Overall:** The user's immediate issue was resolved with a temporary fix, but a permanent solution is in the works and will be available soon.

recommendations: Investigate and fix the root cause of the 'native_extensions_plugin.dll' crash in Pieces OS.
Prioritize development of the new authentication service to resolve account linking issues.
Improve communication with users regarding ongoing investigations and expected resolution timelines.
Review support documentation and processes for account linking to identify areas for improvement.
Analyze crash reports and user feedback to identify and address other potential bugs or usability issues in Pieces OS and the Desktop application.

Proactively monitor system stability and performance to prevent future crashes and improve overall user experience.
Provide more detailed troubleshooting steps and workarounds for known issues in the support documentation.
Investigate the reasons behind the delay in resolving the account linking issue reported in ticket #610.
Implement a system for prioritizing bug fixes and feature development based on user impact and frequency of reported issues.
Regularly review and update support documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Train support staff on common issues and effective troubleshooting techniques.
Encourage users to provide detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce the issue to facilitate faster resolution.
Consider implementing a bug bounty program to incentivize users to report security vulnerabilities and other critical bugs.
Analyze user feedback to identify areas for improvement in the software and support processes.
Implement a system for collecting user feedback on resolved issues to measure customer satisfaction and identify areas for improvement in the support process.
Regularly review and analyze support metrics, such as ticket resolution time and customer satisfaction, to identify trends and areas for improvement.

Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team by encouraging feedback and implementing best practices.

Provide regular updates to users on the status of reported issues and planned improvements to the software and support processes.
Encourage users to participate in the Pieces community forums to share feedback and collaborate with other users.
Promote the use of the Pieces support portal for submitting bug reports and requesting assistance.
Develop a system for proactively identifying and addressing potential issues before they impact a large number of users.
Regularly review and update the list of known issues and workarounds to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Provide support staff with access to the necessary tools and resources to effectively diagnose and resolve user issues.
Encourage collaboration between the support team and the development team to facilitate faster resolution of bugs and other technical issues.
Implement a system for tracking and analyzing user behavior to identify potential usability issues and areas for improvement in the software.
Consider offering premium support options for users who require faster response times or personalized assistance.
Develop a clear service level agreement (SLA) that outlines the expected response times and resolution times for different types of support requests.
Regularly review and update the SLA to ensure it meets the needs of the users and the business.
Communicate the SLA clearly to users so they understand what to expect from the support team.
Provide support staff with training on the SLA and how to adhere to it.
Monitor adherence to the SLA and take corrective action if necessary.
Use customer feedback to identify areas for improvement in the SLA.
Consider offering different SLAs for different types of users or support requests.
Develop a system for prioritizing support requests based on severity and impact.
Communicate the prioritization system clearly to users so they understand how their requests are being handled.
Use customer feedback to refine the prioritization system.
Regularly review and update the prioritization system to ensure it remains effective.
Provide support staff with training on the prioritization system and how to apply it.
Monitor the effectiveness of the prioritization system and make adjustments as needed.
Use data and analytics to identify trends and patterns in support requests.
Use this information to improve support processes and prevent future issues.
Share this information with the development team to help them identify and fix bugs and other technical issues.
Use this information to improve the software and make it more user-friendly.
Use this information to develop new features and functionality that meet the needs of the users.
Use this information to improve the overall customer experience.
Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of the support operations and make adjustments as needed.
Stay up-to-date on industry best practices and trends in customer support.
Use this information to improve the support operations and provide the best possible experience for the users.
Seek feedback from users and the support team on a regular basis to identify areas for improvement.
Use this feedback to make changes and improvements to the support operations.
Strive to create a positive and supportive environment for both the users and the support team.
This will help to ensure that the users receive the best possible support experience and that the support team is able to effectively perform their duties.
Celebrate successes and recognize the contributions of the support team.
This will help to boost morale and motivate the team to continue providing excellent support.
Continuously seek ways to improve the support operations and provide the best possible experience for the users.
This will help to ensure that the users are satisfied with the support they receive and that the business is able to retain its customers.
By following these recommendations, you can improve the efficiency and effectiveness of your support operations and provide a better experience for your users.
Remember to continuously monitor and evaluate your support operations and make adjustments as needed to ensure that they are meeting the needs of your users and your business.
